text:
@lil steppa  well here's something else incredible in addition to all the effects I mentioned it having another reported effect is also eliminating strife/creating a peaceful atmosphere. here's some testimonials:
Jose Antonio Magmud, Doctor in Homeopathy
Bogota, Colombia, South America

"Master Vasant was here 10 years ago. We toured the area 'Villa de Leiva', close to Bogotá. When we arrived in Villa de Leiva we did the Homa fires on a farm. As soon as we did the Homa fires on the farm, it started raining. It had not rained for 2 years!
I would like to share another testimony related to violence that happened to some friends  in Villavicenico which was a guerrilla area.  They got a warning of a possible guerrilla attack, so they started doing the Homa fires and that never happened." Miguel Zapata, M.D.
Bogota, Colombia, South America

"I introduced Homa Therapy to some friends who had a farm in Casemare close to Boyacá. This area was affected by the 'Paramilitaries  who would steal  cows and kill people.
After they started with the practice of the Homa fires, these Paramilitaries became their friends and protected them. Never again anything bad happened to them." Testimonials came from this article https://www.homa1.com/noticias/newsletter_31.htm
author: justin filipovic

text: @lil steppa  I'm guessing that there probably isn't any rice there so I thought I'd let you know that rice isn't the only thing that can be used, the vedic text that describes the agnihotra practice says there are three things you can use; rice, millet and sesame seeds

text: The Dinka have no reason to be friendly towards Sudanese Arabs.

text:
@Ghai Jal  

Are you Nuer?
author: Ta-Seti Kasu

text: @Ta-Seti Kasu  Did nuer fight alongside arabs?
author: lil steppa

text:
@lil steppa  

Yes, they did. 

There were tens of thousands of Nuer militiamen that fought alongside Khartoum's forces during the war. 

Their alliance with the North prolonged the war and set us back by decades.
author: Ta-Seti Kasu

text: @Ta-Seti Kasu  no wonder why we dinkas hate them
author: lil steppa

text: @Ta-Seti Kasu  so we probably could have won the war if nuer werent on there  side right
author: lil steppa

text:
@lil steppa  

"Hatred" is far too strong a term and it's entirely inappropriate. Profound disappointment and disgust seems a little more fitting. 

I'm guilty of having allowed myself to fall under its sway in the past. 

I'm thoroughly ashamed of having peddled hate towards other South Sudanese groups based on their alignment and alliances during the North-South war. 

I really don't think that we could have "won" the war if the Nuer hadn't defected, however, I don't think it would have been almost entirely confined to the South if widespread treachery hadn't taken hold.
author: Ta-Seti Kasu

text:
Milk is not  mix with blood maybe cow urine, I bet he misunderstood it.
I agree with the saying that people should not based on only livestocks because there are so many negatives infact then the positive leaving in this life that increases human death from 
1-The environment they live in causes so many diseases that affect their circulatory systems leading to early deaths.
2.Due to lack of knowledge, there are so many ways the consumes unhealthy foods like drinking milk unboiled, process of milking cattle with dirty hands and utensils used and more.
3.Attack and killing of human beings by other animal keepers.
4.Due to their cattle ,there is early and forced marriage for both girls and boys and more especially to girls.
5.There is low understanding about education where most of the parents thinks boys are born to protect animals and girls are married off to bring more cattle .

text: @DZG-VSF Belgium :  I know the Dinka language in it entirely and the translation is absolutely correct. I don't see the need that this work could have been translated better. The one who did the translation did not translate word by word but the content and that is event what make it beautiful. There might be different choice of words if I do translate of someone else but that will not change the meaning.

author: grace gg

text: Not the farms we are promoting: small-scall extensive (thus not intensive) livestock farming. Intensive, industrialized farms do cause part of global climate change, but the farming system of the Dinka doesn't. On the contrary, small-scale livestock keeping helps to cope with climate change because herds are moving around to look for (naturally available) pasture and water, in an area where crop farming would require extensive irrigation of water (which is not ready available). Read more here: http://www.vsf-belgium.org/en/news/item/282-small-scale-livestock-keeping-a-solution-to-climate-change
author: DZG-VSF Belgium
